text: the colors of the Brazilian flag
occupying some Paulo's iconic Paulista
Avenue and streets across the country
from north to south protesters of all
ages are here calling for the
impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff
and an early end to the workers party's
14 years in government the huge mistrust
faced by the president is evident
everywhere Alton the levels of the
government are corrupt and troops and we
want to get rid of all of them
everything it's we want our country back
we went to Brazil
Brazil's optimistic boom years had been
fueled by high commodity prices but the
country is now facing its worst
recession in decades the economy shrunk
3.8 percent last year President Rousseff
has been accused of mismanaging the
economy and is stuck in a deepening
political crisis due to the so-called
car wash scandal investigators found
that hundreds of millions of dollars
were siphoned from state-run oil company
Petrobras in the biggest corruption
scandal in Brazilian history involving
high-profile politicians construction
companies and middlemen last week former
President Luiz in√°cio Lula da Silva
the founder of the ruling Workers Party
was detained for questioning prosecutors
say he benefited from the corruption
scheme but his supporters were outraged
and accused investigators of being
partisan and acting to destabilize the
government the move increased pressure
on President Rousseff who defends her
mandate resignation is a voluntary act
there's no legal basis for me to leave
my position I will not leave this
mandate without a reason political
scientists fil Cuates says large popular
pressure could tip the balance against
the government but the question is is
the lack of popularity of the prevent
and economy crisis that we are
leaving right now reasons enough in
order to make the impeachment or not
leaving the president even more isolated
than she already is ahead of the
impeachment proceedings
